trans-unit.target: TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_00<tab>Sanson has acquired information on the Ballad of Oblivion.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_01<tab>Sanson informs you that he has received information from Ser Alamenain on the Ballad of Oblivion. Specifically, the woman who is said to sing the song is a soldier stationed at the Convictory. Sanson declares that the three of you will go there to seek her out. Make your way to the Ishgardian encampment and join your companions.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_02<tab>You have tracked down the soldier, Celaine. However, though she admits to singing the song, she stubbornly refuses to teach it to you. Presently, Guydelot is attempting to coax it out of her; ask him how his efforts fare.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_03<tab>No amount of words will sway Celaine to teach you the song, and Guydelot is loath to press her further. But Sanson, determined to accomplish his duty, proposes a deal: the three of you will assist the Ishgardians in a dragon-culling operation in exchange for being near in case Celaine employs the song in battle. Make your way to Twinpools and present yourself to the Convictor knight to receive instructions.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_04<tab>The Convictor knight bids you help by thinning out the dragons. Lie in wait at the location he has marked on your map, and defeat the creatures that appear.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_05<tab>You have dispatched a sufficient number of dragons. Rejoin Sanson and the others.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_06<tab>Though the culling operation is a success, the Convictors have incurred heavy losses. Stricken with sadness, Celaine begins singing a requiem for her fallen comrades, which Guydelot recognizes as the song to send souls unto the heavens. Follow Sanson's lead and pay your respects with a /salute.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_07<tab>Appreciative of your gesture, Celaine opens up to you. At Guydelot's encouragement, she resolves to savor the time she has with her comrades, rather than keep them at arm's length to spare herself the pain of loss. In her turn, she counsels Guydelot and Sanson to appreciate each other's company. Finally, she speaks of the requiem, which she says was taught to her by a scholar of Ishgardian history named Sylviel, who is based in the settlement of Tailfeather. Speak with Sanson to learn what your next step will be.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_08<tab>It is decided that you will go to Tailfeather to seek out Sylviel. Make your way to the settlement in the Dravanian forelands and rejoin your companions.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SEQ_09<tab>Sylviel has apparently left Tailfeather on one of his many surveys, and you must await his return. With the mission taking you into ever more perilous territory, see to it that you are fully prepared for whatever lies ahead.
※The next bard quest will be available upon reaching level 56.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_000<tab>To be a bard means to let your heart guide you as much as your head. ...That's what I think, at least.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_005<tab>Good tidings, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! We've received information from Ser Alamenain regarding the Ballad of Oblivion!

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_006<tab>You will recall the woman he mentioned─the one who sends souls unto the heavens with a song. She is apparently a soldier stationed at the Convictory. Let us go there at once!
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_007<tab>Guydelot, you are coming with us!
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_010<tab>I'm sorry, but the answer is no.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_011<tab>Well, if you're not up to it, I won't press you. A song isn't something you can force out of someone.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_015<tab>We have found the soldier, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>─Celaine is her name. Alas, though she admits to singing the song, she refuses to teach it to us.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_016<tab>Guydelot is doing his best to coax it out of her. For once, his way with women may serve an honorable cause.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_020<tab>Guydelot is doing his best to persuade Celaine to teach us her song. For once, his way with women may serve an honorable cause.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_025<tab>You won't sing for us; I don't have a problem with that. But could you at least tell us why? It'd help to ease our disappointment.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_026<tab>I'm no bard─just a simple soldier. And it isn't a song I would willingly sing.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_027<tab>The lady has spoken. Seems to me there's nothing else we can do.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_028<tab>You would give up, just like that? We have a duty to accomplish!
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_030<tab>Begging your pardons, but your comrade gave me to understand that an operation is due to be conducted presently.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_031<tab>Aye, dragon numbers are on the rise, and we go to cull them.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_032<tab>If you are not averse, we would lend you our aid. The operation would be better for the extra hands, and should you have occasion to employ the song in battle, we would be able to hear it.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_033<tab>...Very well. You may join us, but on one condition: you are to provide our forces with support only.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_034<tab>All right, we have work to do. The operation will take place at Twinpools, to the north and west. Let us present ourselves to the commander and offer him our aid.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_035<tab>And he throws a hissy fit when I do something spontaneous. Hmph.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_036<tab>Well, let's make ourselves useful, the only way a bard can.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_040<tab>This is rather sudden, I know full well, but it is for the sake of our mission.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_041<tab>Remember, you are to provide support only.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_042<tab>Rest assured I don't plan on charging into the fray. No, sir, I'm content to stand back and strum out a song or three.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CAVALRY01715_000_045<tab>You would join us in the cull? The Holy See thanks you!

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CAVALRY01715_000_046<tab>Seeing as you are skilled in the bow, you may help us by thinning out the beasts. I shall mark a spot on your map; pray focus your efforts upon this area.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_047<tab>I shall remain close by, in case you have occasion to employ the song.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_048<tab>Do as you will. Just see that you do not overreach yourself.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_049<tab>Go to our assigned positions, do what we always do─seems straightforward enough!
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CAVALRY01715_000_055<tab>Seeing as you are skilled in the bow, you may help us by thinning out the dragons. Please focus your efforts upon the area I marked on your map.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_056<tab>I'll not stray a fulm from Celaine's side!
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_057<tab>Stay back! Don't make me say it again!
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_058<tab>Shouldn't you be elsewhere, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>? Leave this spot to us, and run along to your own.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_060<tab>Again, so many lives lost...
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_061<tab>The cull's finally over. I had no idea dragons were so bloody tough. And those were the <var 1A 02 /var>lesser<var 1A 01 /var> ones.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_065<tab>Not once did Celaine perform the song...
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_066<tab>And though the operation itself was a success, her people suffered heavy losses.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_067<tab>Farewell, my friends. Your sacrifice will not be forgotten.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_100_067<tab>Rest now, O valiant souls,♪ Lay down your weary heads.♪ Go unto the bosom of the Fury,♪ In Whose exalted name you bled.♪
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_068<tab>A requiem?
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_070<tab>The song to send souls unto the heavens... <var 1A 02 /var>This<var 1A 01 /var> is what it was.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_072<tab>I was trying to make you sing a song of mourning? Gods strike me down for a callous fool...
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_073<tab>For once, Sanson has it right. Let's show our respects to Celaine's fallen comrades.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_075<tab>Gods strike me down for a callous fool...
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_076<tab>For once, Sanson has it right. Let's show our respects to Celaine's fallen comrades.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SYSTEM_100_080<tab>Pay your respects by <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>saluting<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Celaine.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_080<tab>You need not feel bad. The fault is mine for not offering a proper explanation.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_081<tab>Men fall far too often in this war we wage. Wishing to spare myself the pain of loss, I've kept my comrades at a distance. Yet I always find myself racked with regret that I didn't reach out to them before they were taken.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_082<tab>Aye, far better to taste pain than to live with regret. There's no need to deprive yourself of the joy of friendship.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_083<tab>I won't. Not anymore. I shall learn to savor the time I have with my comrades...as should you.

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_084<tab>The two of you bicker like an old couple, but life is too short to waste squabbling with your own. So cast aside your differences, and have joy of each other's company while you still can.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_085<tab>As for the requiem I sang...it was taught to me by a scholar of Ishgardian history. If there is a man alive who knows the song you seek, it will be he.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_CELAINE_000_086<tab>Sylviel is his name, and you will find him at Tailfeather. I suggest you pay him a visit. I take my leave of you.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_090<tab>Celaine's song was simple, but she sang with all her heart. Therein lies the power of a bard.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_095<tab>Let us go to Tailfeather, as Celaine recommends. This Sylviel may know the song, and failing that, he may at least be able to direct us to it.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_096<tab>It's the fervent desire to aid our comrades that bestows our songs with power.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_097<tab>It makes me wonder, what sort of desire is needed for a song that destroys all?
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_100<tab>I'm playing around with chords to accompany Celaine's melody.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_105<tab>It appears Sylviel is presently afield on one of his surveys. We must await his return.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_106<tab>Tell me, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, what thoughts have you on Celaine's inner struggles?

TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_GUYDELOT_000_107<tab>...That's some deep stuff, <var 08 E905 ((sister)) ((brother)) /var>. Truly insightful. A pity that's all lost on Sanson─the bastard's got eyes for naught but his bloody tome.
TEXT_JOBBRD540_01715_SANSON_000_108<tab>Our mission takes us into ever more perilous territory. Pray see to it you are fully prepared for the trials ahead.
